intro: Couratari krukovii, commonly known as the Brazilian chestnut, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
